p: To assess the effects of T. capitatus EO on the isolated nerve excitability, we performed the single sucrose technique. This method enables the study of bioactive compounds on the peripheral nerve by measuring the CAP evoked by external electrodes (Alves et al. 2010; Gonçalves et al. 2010). According to the presented data, we have demonstrated that T. capitatus EO impede nervous transmission by blocking the CAP amplitude, in a concentration- and time-dependent manner ( Figure 2(A) and (B)). In addition, such effect was reverted by washing the drug out. These data also suggest that T. capitatus EO did not damage the nerve fibres functionality during the experimentation period.
